titleStmt.title: The mirrour of mindes, or, Barclay's Icon animorum, Englished by T.M.
Satyricon. Part 4. English
titleStmt.author: Barclay, John, 1582-1621.
May, Thomas, 1595-1650.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Iohn Norton for Thomas Walkley, and are to bee sold at his shop, at the signe of the Eagle and Child in Britaines-Burse,

notesStmt.note: "Icon animorum" is generally regarded as part 4 of Barclay's "Satyricon".
The first leaf and the last leaf are blank.
The tenth chapter begins new pagination and register.
Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.

place.placeName: his shop, at the signe of the Eagle
